entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: In a prosperous household near the mighty Brahmaputra River, golden light pours through the courtyard where a young girl plays...

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: Baba! Look how high I can jump!
entries.textAssamese: বাবা! চোৱা মই কিমান ওখকৈ জপিয়াব পাৰোঁ!

entries.speaker: Father
entries.text: Be careful, my little flower! Come, let me show you something in the garden.
entries.textAssamese: সাৱধান হোৱা, মোৰ সৰু ফুল! আহা, বাগিচাত তোমাক কিবা এটা দেখুৱাওঁ।

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: [Scene - Father gives Tejimola a golden hairpin near the nahor tree]

entries.speaker: Father
entries.text: This flower will always bloom for you. I am here for you, always.
entries.textAssamese: এই ফুলটো তোমাৰ বাবে সদায় ফুলি থাকিব। মই তোমাৰ বাবে সদায় ইয়াত আছোঁ।

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: What a beautiful flower! I will keep it forever, Baba!
entries.textAssamese: কি ধুনীয়া ফুল! মই ইয়াক চিৰদিনৰ বাবে ৰাখিম, বাবা!

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Explore the household. This is your home - warm, familiar, and filled with love.

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: The kitchen smells wonderful! Baba always makes the best pitha.
entries.textAssamese: ৰান্ধনীশালত কি সুন্দৰ গোন্ধ! বাবাই সদায় সকলোতকৈ ভাল পিঠা বনায়।

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: My room... my safe place. All my toys are here.
entries.textAssamese: মোৰ কোঠা... মোৰ নিৰাপদ ঠাই। মোৰ সকলো খেলনা ইয়াত আছে।

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Time passes. The colors of the world begin to fade...

entries.speaker: Village Elder
entries.text: He was a good man. The river carries his soul now. We must believe in what comes after.
entries.textAssamese: তেওঁ এজন ভাল মানুহ আছিল। নদীয়ে এতিয়া তেওঁৰ আত্মা বহন কৰিছে।

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: Baba... why did you leave? Why did you go?
entries.textAssamese: বাবা... তুমি কিয় গুচি গ'লা? তুমি কিয় গ'লা?

choices.text: I'll be strong, Baba. I promise.

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: The house feels so empty without you. The nahor tree still blooms but... everything feels cold.

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: You told me the flowers always bloom. I will remember that. I will be brave.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: And so, the merchant's household changed forever. When the father remarried...

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: ...Ranima arrived. And with her, the shadows grew longer.

entries.speaker: Ranima
entries.text: So this is the girl. Don't smile at me like that.

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: I... welcome to our home, Ma.

entries.speaker: Ranima
entries.text: Your father is gone now. You will do as I say.
